title: SLS Stages in assembly at MAF for future NASA Artemis launches
summary: Boeing, the prime Stages contractor for NASA’s Space Launch System (SLS) program, is working on the production and development of hardware for the third and fourth Artemis launches at the Michoud Assembly Facility (MAF) in New Orleans. Welded and bolted structures for the third and fourth Core Stage vehicles are being assembled in parallel with preparations to begin the initial production of the new Exploration Upper Stage (EUS).

title: Isotropic Systems rebrands as All.Space and unveils latest terminal
summary: Isotropic Systems is changing its name to All.Space as the British antenna manufacturer unveil its “fifth-generation smart terminal” to link cellular and satellite networks.

title: We’re about to enter the heart of the Atlantic hurricane season
summary: About 90 percent of the Atlantic's tropical activity comes after August 1.

title: Space Force to take on bigger role planning future DoD space investments
summary: As “integrator for joint space requirements" the Space Force will have to coordinate the wish lists of the Army, Navy, Marine Corps and Air Force, and recommend how to meet future needs

title: Roscosmos head revises comments about quitting ISS after 2024
summary: The new head of Russia’s space agency backed away from comments suggesting Russia would withdraw from the International Space Station as soon as 2024 but expressed doubts Russia would be involved through 2030.
